abstract: Also, more questions in Britain over News Corporation’s bid to own BSkyB, and a first-edition copy of “The Book of Mormon” has been stolen.
snippet: Also, more questions in Britain over News Corporation’s bid to own BSkyB, and a first-edition copy of “The Book of Mormon” has been stolen.
lead_paragraph: Penguin Group USA and Macmillan, the two publishers who did not settle with the government over its lawsuit on e-book prices, responded to the charges on Wednesday by denying that they had fixed prices with Apple and other major publishing houses, Julie Bosman reports. But they also said that the government was siding with a monopolist by advancing the cause of Amazon. Penguin’s response, she writes, called Amazon “predatory” and a “monopolist” that treats books as “widgets.”

headline.main: The Breakfast Meeting: Publishers Blame Amazon, and a ‘Mental Mincemeat’ Maker
